title: Unilever to resume advertising on Facebook, Twitter in U.S.
text: Unilever Plc said it would resume advertising on Facebook Inc, Instagram and Twitter Inc in the United States after pausing in June due to divisiveness and hate speech on the platforms during the U.S. election period.

title: Facebook, Google Engaged in Anticompetitive Behavior: Mass. AG Healey
text: Dec.17 -- On Wednesday, Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton filed an antitrust lawsuit against Alphabet Inc.'s Google, alleging Google colluded with archrival Facebook Inc. in an illegal deal to manipulate auctions for online advertising, Massachusetts Attorney General Maura Healey discusses the case on "Bloomberg Technology."

title: FTC competition director on Big Tech antitrust scrutiny
text: CNBC's "Squawk Alley" team is joined by Ian Conner, the FTC's Bureau of Competition director, to break down Big Tech antitrust concerns.

title: Facebook vs. Apple ad battle is a PR battle: Kindred Ventures' Jang
text: CNBC's "Squawk Alley" team discusses how Facebook is taking on Apple over privacy issues with Steve Jang of Kindred Ventures and Hans Tung of GGV Capital.

title: What Will Drive the Next Leg of Growth for FAANG Stocks in 2021?
text: The FAANG stocks -- AMZN, AAPL, NFLX, FB & GOOGL -- are expected to maintain momentum in 2021 based on rapid adoption of 5G and expansion into growth markets like India.

title: Facebook (FB), Google Accused of Illegal Ad Deal by US States
text: Facebook (FB) woes mount as the antitrust probe with Google over ad revenues comes at a time when the company is dealing with the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Why this tech analyst says investors may consolidate their tech trades in 2021
text: CNBC's "Squawk on the Street" team discusses the tech sector and the growth that the Nasdaq Composite has seen in 2020 with lead tech analyst Mark Mahaney of RBC Capital Markets.

title: Facebook says it is assisting ‘Fortnite' developer with anti-Apple lawsuit
text: Facebook's conflict with Apple is escalating into a battle royale — and the social network is teaming up with “Fortnite” against the iPhone maker. The same day that Facebook embarked on a blitz of full-page newspaper ads slamming Apple's iPhone privacy update, Facebook announced that it would be helping “Fortnite” developer Epic Games in its.

title: Facebook: Why I'm Not Too Worried About The Antitrust Suits
text: Antitrust charges were filed against Facebook for anticompetitive behaviour relating to acquisitions that stifled competition, and providing selective access to its APIs. In a worst-case scenario, WhatsApp and Instagram could be divested, which would be negative for total shareholder value in my opinion.

title: Cramer on Facebook-Apple clash over ad-tracking changes
text: Facebook is stepping up its criticism of Apple's ad-tracking and privacy changes by running newspaper ads. The social network says it is standing up to Apple for small businesses everywhere, claiming that Apple's changes will be devastating to them and limit businesses' ability to run personalized ads and reach their customers effectively.

title: Facebook Is Preparing to Copy Cameo
text: The social networking giant is developing a new feature that connects fans with celebrities.

title: 7 Crypto Stocks to Buy as We Head Into 2021
text: As bitcoin, etherium and other cryptocurrencies continue to gain in popularity, so do crypto stocks. Let's look at seven of them.

title: Facebook and Google have been accused of striking a secret, illegal advertising deal
text: Google struck an illegal, under-the-table deal with Facebook, a coalition of state attorneys general have said. The coalition, led by Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton, on Wednesday filed an antitrust lawsuit against Google. The suit accuses Google of unfairly leveraging monopoly power in its adtech business.

title: Apple hits back after Facebook attack on new privacy feature
text: Apple has responded to Facebook after it attacked a new privacy feature the iPhone-maker is set to rollout next year.

title: 10 U.S. states accuse Google of working with Facebook to break antitrust law and boost ads business
text: Texas and nine other states sued Google on Wednesday, accusing it of working with Facebook in an unlawful manner.

title: Facebook slams Apple privacy change again, suggesting it will kill free apps
text: The day after launching an attack on Apple's upcoming privacy change, Facebook is running new ads around content monetization.
